publicationStmt.publisher: To the Reader: The English Preface in Print, c. 1475-1640 / Early English Books Online Text Creation Partnership

monogr.title: Soli gloria Deo. Certaine rare and nevv inventions for the manuring and improving of all sorts of ground : Published by the author, for the helpe and instruction of all those that having any barraine land or other, and that are desirous to use the same unto their best profi and the publique good
monogr.author: Shaw, John, inventor

keywords.term: Agriculture, viticulture, texts on hunting, veterinary science

div.head: The Conclusion of the Author.
div.p:
WHEREAS his Majestie hath beene graciously pleased out of his Royall favour, to Graunt, and Confirme divers Powers and Priviledges by his Majesties Letters Pattents, vnder the Great Seale for the said Inventions, and for divers other wayes for the Manuring
and Improving of Ground, that as yet have not been found out, nor practised by any. Therefore desiring, that my selfe and all others, that wish well vnto the publique Good, may proceed in an Imployment so laudable and beneficiall for the whole Kingdome; out of a gratefull minde, I shall willingly admit all those freely to vse any of the said Inventions, and to exercise any of the said wayes for the Manuring and Improving of Ground, that shall helpe eyther mee, my Agents or Assignes, vnto any Barren land vpon reasonable Conditions, or that shall bee forward in assisting mee in the accomplishing and Exercising thereof.
In Fleet-street at the Signe of the three Flower Deluces, over against St. Brides▪lane and, there may any one see divers of the said Inventions, or be further informed if they please.
